programme.title: Liszt -- Piano Concerto No. 2, S.125
programme.desc: Classica celebrates close friendships in classical music, Brahms and Schumann.

programme.title: Chopin - Piano Concerto No. 2, Op. 21
programme.desc: The annual Europa Konzert is performed in Kraków, Poland; the Berliner Philharmoniker and Bernard Haitink perform works by Mozart, Chopin and Schumann.

programme.title: Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up and coming artists.

programme.title: Beethoven - Symphony No. 5 in C Minor, Op. 67

programme.title: Martha Argerich: A Birthday Celebration #1
programme.desc: On the occasion of her 80th birthday, Argentinian pianist Martha Argerich explores chamber music repertoire in this concert, recorded at Château de Chantilly, France.

programme.title: Mirabile Mysterium - A Christmas Tale
programme.desc: Conductor Paul Van Nevel and his Huelgas Ensemble present the ideal Christmas program, consisting of an atmospheric musical selection of 14th to 19th-century compositions.

programme.title: J. S. Bach - Chamber music
programme.desc: The program has a fine selection of Bach's works performed by French lutenist Thomas Dunford; concert coverage from Concertgebouw Brugge, Belgium, 2017.

programme.title: Slatkin Conducts Saint-Saëns and Poulenc
programme.desc: Leonard Slatkin conducts the Orchestre National de Lyon in a concert recorded at the Auditorium de Lyon in France, 2013. The concert is a tribute to the organ of the Maurice-Ravel Auditorium, which was made by Aristide Cavaillé-Coll.

programme.sub-title: Baroque Choral Music by Bach, Schütz, et al
programme.desc: A five-strong vocal ensemble amarcord is joined by an extra alto and two soprano voices for this unusual concert at Leipzig's St. Thomas Church; as amarcordplus, the ensemble presents a program focused on the city of Leipzig.

programme.title: Septets by Mozart & Beethoven

programme.title: Slatkin conducts Bolcom, Beethoven & Ravel
programme.desc: American Leonard Slatkin conducts France's Orchestre National de Lyon in a concert recorded at the Auditorium de Lyon in 2014. The concert opens with William Bolcom´s Circus Ouverture, which was specially composed for Slatkin's 70th birthday.

programme.title: Mahler - Rückert-Lieder
programme.desc: Welsh soprano Margaret Price performs Gustav Mahler's "Rückert-Lieder," accompanied by the Orchester der Ludwigsburger Schloßfestspiele under the baton of Wolfgang Gönnenwein.
